Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian pottery black-figured krater; interior reserved; exterior: cream slip, paint fired red; grazing fallow deer (head turned round); zone of solid tongues above the main decorated field; filling ornaments: roughly drawn rosettes and blobs; red patches on eye, neck, dots and hind leg of fallow deer; drill hole on broken edge for analysis.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis) (according to Ashmolean Museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 80, no. 42, pl. IV. Very probably from same krater as British Museum 1924,1201.988 and 990.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D p. 80 and pl. IV, 42.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.665)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.15)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
